hero_subtitle: MatchMaker simplifies your tournaments — from creation to live score tracking, all in one clean, responsive interface.
hero_description: MatchMaker is a modern web application for managing tournaments and sharing them with others, by delivering seamless real-time scores updates, dynamic ranking and bracket visualization. Whether you’re hosting a local event or an online competition, MatchMaker makes organization effortless.

feature_description_tournament: Create your tournament, define teams and participants, and manage match generation and score updates effortlessly.
feature_description_bracket: Generate and explore elimination brackets dynamically with smooth animations and clear team progress tracking.
feature_description_sharing: Easily share your tournament with spectators by sending them a unique code, or via a QR code for instant mobile access.
feature_description_scores: Allow spectators to follow the action in real time with instantly highlighted score changes — no page refresh required.
feature_description_languages: Switch seamlessly between English, French, and Spanish for an inclusive, user-friendly experience.
about_description: MatchMaker was built out of a desire to simplify tournament creation and management for organizers. Built with Django and React, and using WebSocket Communication, it allows easy generation and visualization of tournament structures — from round-robin to bracket formats — and to provide interactive tools for friends, leagues, or competitive communities without complex setups or paid services.
about_description_idea: Discussion and decision to build a flexible, simple tournament web application and establishment of the project charter and technical documentation.
about_description_prototype: API development with full tournament operations, persistent storage with database integration, secure authentication system and full user interface with theme and language handling.
about_description_release: Deployment and SEO for referencement, bug fixes, final design improvements and early feedback from real use cases.
